definition: to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: The government has pledged itself to send aid to the famine victims.
The Government acted quickly to relieve the widespread distress caused by the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 地震造成大范围的灾难，政府迅速采取行动赈济灾民。

sentences.english: After the flood, many people contributed food and clothing for the relief of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 洪灾后，许多人捐助食物和衣物以赈济灾民。

sentences.english: Government also supplies relief for the poor and help for the disabled.
sentences.chinese: 政府还赈济穷人，照顾残废者。

sentences.english: Another, but also more evidence of relief from the nobility of the Hsiang-tang.
sentences.chinese: 另一类，也是更多的证据来自贵族对乡党的赈济。

sentences.english: However, the standard and procedure for the scholars were the same as those for the general people.
sentences.chinese: 但生员赈济的标准与普通贫民基本相同。

sentences.english: Some people able and willing to work were forced to accept doles.
sentences.chinese: 一些有能力也愿意工作的人被迫接受赈济品。

sentences.english: In fact, such a relief activities and to form the relationship between the Community is also questionable.
sentences.chinese: 其实这种赈济活动与结成共同体的关系也是有疑问的。

definition: land tax/money and grain (given as tax or tribute)
to let sb off (punishment, taxation etc)/to reprieve sb
emergency relief/to help the needy with cash or goods
